resources.string: "They were built as dungeons. The cells in the dungeon now house shops, boutiques and other businesses along the stout walls protecting the old city of Cartagena, Colombia."
"Owes his name to the santo domingo church, located in one of his corners."

"Is an archipelago located off the coast of Colombia. This area was declared Natural National Park due to the necessity to preserve and protect the coral reefs and the associated ecosystems, such as the sea grass and mangroves, and the numerous species of seaweed and animals that inhabit them."

"Is a fortress in the city of Cartagena. It was built in 1536 by the Spanish during the colonial era. In 1984, UNESCO listed the castle, with the historic centre of the city of Cartagena, as a World Heritage Site."

"The Downtown area of Cartagena has varied architecture, mainly a colonial style, but republican and Italian style buildings, such as the Cathedral's bell tower, can be seen. The walls of the city were built to protect to protect their treasures."

"Created by:
Sergio Gomez Arboleda
sergio9210@outlook.com
Electronic Engineering student
Universidad de Antioquia
 This application was made for helping each tourist that visit the city of Cartagena de indias"

"Cartagena is a city located in Colombia's caribbean coast. The port city is the fifth-largest city in Colombia and the second largest in the region, after Barranquilla. Economic activities include maritime and petrochemicals industry, as well as tourism. The city had a population of 2'180.070 divided into:
48 percent mestizos
24.7 percent white people
27 percent Afro-Descendant
0.2 percent Indigenous peoples
0.1 percent Romani people"

The sea breeze and the sunset that transform the colors of 400 years old houses enchant visitors in Cartagena. A world heritage size, this city was founded by Pedro de Heredia in 1533; the colonial architecture of its buildings is protected by the most complete set of fortifications in South America.
